author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: March Madness: No. 1 seed Auburn to play Alabama State in Round of 64
text:
March Madness: No. 1 seed Auburn to play Alabama State in Round of 64
Auburn, the top seed in the NCAA Tournament, is set to face Alabama State in the Round of 64. After a strong season finishing 28-5 and winning the SEC championship, the Tigers look to capitalize on their momentum. Senior players, fueled by their desire to extend their college careers, are focused on a championship run. The Hornets come into this matchup after a close victory in the First Four and are eager to prove themselves against a familiar opponent.
- Auburn finished the season with a 28-5 record.
- Alabama State, seeded 16th, holds a 20-15 record.
- Denver Jones has a team-leading 3-point shooting percentage of 41.6%.
- Auburn is confident after a dominating season, with significant postseason expectations.
- Alabama State enters with renewed energy after a last-second win over Saint Francis.
- Both teams have a history with Auburn previously defeating Alabama State by 20 points last season.
The outcome of this first-round game will determine Auburn's path as they aim for the championship, needing to win six more games to achieve their goal. Expect high stakes and an intense matchup at Rupp Arena.
Bottom LineAuburn's focus on defense and rebounding will be crucial in securing a win against Alabama State. With a motivated team and a strong track record, they are poised to make a deep run in the tournament, but must treat every opponent with respect to avoid an upset.
Read more at Auburn Tigers - Official Athletics Website

author: @wbkotv
title: Retired police sergeant on vacation with family rescues couple from sinking car
text: Retired police sergeant on vacation with family rescues couple from sinking car CINCINNATI ( [WXIX](https://www.fox19.com/2024/06/21/retired-cpd-sergeant-family-rescue-unknown-tri-state-couple-during-florida-vacation/)/Gray News) - A retired Cincinnati police sergeant and his family saved an Ohio couple who just happened to be vacationing in the same area in Florida. The Ramsey family is from Ohio, while the Bell family lives in northern Kentucky. Up until June 11, the two families had no idea they lived so close to one another. Some might call it a coincidence. Others will say it’s luck, but these two families call it a miracle. Dean and Shana Ramsey recall the moment they said they almost drowned while vacationing in Siesta Key, Florida. Several streets flooded that day after the area received more than 11 inches of rain, an abnormal amount, according to Sarasota County officials. “You couldn’t see anything but rain and water,” Dean Ramsey recalled. With several cars stalled on the road, the couple said they tried to pull off on what they thought was land. “The water sucked us right into that lagoon and that was it,” Dean Ramsey explained. Watching in horror from their condo was retired Cincinnati Police Department sergeant Mike Bell, his wife Ginger Bell and their three young kids. The Bell family responded. “We were able to stop, slow things down, and assess and make some decisions on how we were going to move forward,” Mike Bell said. That plan started with Mackenzie Bell giving valuable information to 911. “I remembered they needed to know the address, so that’s the first thing I told her and then I told her a car is in the pond and there was two people in there,” Mike’s and Ginger Bell’s daughter, Mackenzie Bell, said. Meanwhile, the retired sergeant and his wife, who is an emergency medical doctor, took action. “I went over to the edge of the water and realized it wasn’t sinking immediately, so I have a few minutes,” Mike Bell recounted from that moment. “At that time, Ginger exited the front door next to the pond. I look at her and said, ‘We need flotation devices.’” That’s where little Hank Bell came in. “I didn’t want them to die, so I ran as fast as I could,” Hank Bell explained. “I went up the elevator, which is extremely slow, and I knew there were stairs that were faster. So, I ran down the stairs.” Flotation devices in hand, the Bell kids handed them to their parents who were already in the water. “He went into the lady’s side and I went into the man’s side,” Ginger Bell said. “She was able to climb out on her own, but I put the boogie board right in front of her. She got her body on the boogie board and that’s when I started paddling and we kicked over to the side.” Ginger Bell ran into some issues helping Dean Ramsey. “When he was trying to get out, his foot got stuck, so he was on his back with one foot out and one foot stuck in the steering wheel,” Ginger Bell remembered. “I looked at her and I said, ‘I’m stuck, I can’t,’” Dean Ramsey remembered. “At that time, I was like, ‘I’m going down with the car,’ but she’s like, ‘Get out of this car! You got to get out! Kick your leg!’ I started thrashing my leg and my foot popped out.” The rescue took about five minutes. Back on dry land, the Ramsey family saw their rescuers as “guardian angels.” The families say they have plans to reunite in the near future. The Bell family wants to remind residents to always be mindful of their surroundings and assess a situation before getting involved. They said if your car is going in a body of water, roll down the windows or punch them out by hitting the corners. Those tactics could save a life. Copyright 2024 WXIX via Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved.

author: 文匯報
title: 【特稿】欣喜各界團結 解決住屋難題 - 香港 - 香港文匯網
text:
助劏戶脫苦海 扶持青年上車
●房屋局的「幸福設計」指引助市民安居。圖為完成外牆粉飾等工程的蝴蝶邨。 資料圖片 現屆特區政府透過新思維推出不少政策，單是房屋局便有簡約公屋及簡樸房等項目。房屋局局長何永賢在專訪中感謝社會各界的支持和協助，「很開心大家心意一致，很有心去解決香港過去十幾年一直在談論的房屋問題，並帶出一個希望，就是即使你現時在劏房住得很辛苦，也很快可以有改善的選擇。」
助劏戶脫苦海 扶持青年上車
她說：「大家看到整套『組合拳』，由推出簡約公屋及繼續做過渡性房屋，然後推進建築科技做傳統的新建公屋，再加上很多房屋政策的調整，全套都可以幫助解決劏房問題。其實是社會各界，不論政黨、專業人士抑或整個建築業，也是大家一起落手落腳去支持，當然還少不了一些社福機構的協助。」
何永賢表示，年輕人過往覺得難以置業，但在現時大量居屋單位推出，以及有很多協助年輕人與其家庭的策略協助下，讓他們可看見希望。至於居於公屋的長者，特區政府也提供很多支援，例如「幸福設計」，從長者角度提出設計概念。
此外，特區政府亦放寬一些以往的措施，例如樓巿已「撤辣」等，何永賢說：「整個房屋政策的每個環節，政府都盡力與社會各界一起多聽、多看，真的是擸起衫袖，見到要做的就去做，希望獲得成果。」
讀文匯報PDF版面

author: Maleehah Shakeel
title: Away From Simone Biles, Baby Biles Continues Family Traditions
text:
The Biles family is super close, and Christmas has always been a time for them to come together and celebrate as a family. But this year, Simone Biles switched things up. Instead of spending Christmas with the family, she decided to head to Chicago to be with her husband, Jonathan Owens. She’s there to support him as he gets ready for the Chicago Bears game against the Seahawks at Soldier Field on December 26. While Biles is celebrating Christmas with Owens in a hotel room, the rest of the Biles family is sticking to their usual tradition!
So, Baby Biles, aka Ronni Louise Biles, who’s always hanging out with her “TT” (Aunt Simone), is spending Christmas down in Texas this year for her second one, and she’s loving every minute of it! Meanwhile, Simone’s sister, Adria Biles, who honestly looks like Biles’ twin, posted a sweet “Merry Christmas” message on her Instagram story.
In the video of her, Baby Biles is sitting on Adria’s lap, trying to say the alphabet but it comes out as pure gibberish. Then, their family dog hops in and starts nibbling on Adria’s hands. The best part? Adria and Baby Biles are wearing matching Christmas-themed pajamas. It’s too cute, especially since Baby Biles used to copy Simone’s outfits, but now she’s all about matching with Adria! And speaking of Simone, remember how she always said she wanted to spend Christmas with her family?
ADVERTISEMENT
Article continues below this ad
Back in 2016, Simone Biles made the most of her holiday. Then 19-year-old Simone Biles, tweeted that all she wanted for Christmas was to be with her family and she got her wish. Hours later, she posted some adorable pictures of her with her family on the beach on their vacation. But here’s the best part: the Biles family however didn’t just chill on the beach but went swimming with real sharks!
ADVERTISEMENT
Article continues below this ad
She also went all out in her scuba attire, diving face-deep into the water. And now, fast forward to 2024, Biles is married, but still, her parents probably did miss her, but with Baby Biles already following her “TT,” she did fill Simone Biles’ absence with her cute antics.
What’s your perspective on:
Simone Biles chose love over tradition this Christmas—would you do the same for your partner?
Have an interesting take?
Baby Biles’ adorable moment that proves she’s next Simone Biles
Baby Biles definitely knew how to fangirl! It was no secret that she was totally in awe of her gymnast aunt, Simone Biles, and she always found ways to show her admiration. After cheering her heart out in Paris, Baby Biles was back at it again, this time rocking a dress with a special message on it. In a photo she shared, Ronni Biles was seen wearing a dress while enjoying time at playschool, but what caught everyone’s attention was the message written on her attire: “But still I rise.”
ADVERTISEMENT
Article continues below this ad
At first glance, it might have just seemed like any ordinary text on a dress, but those were the same words Simone had tattooed on her body. It wasn’t the first time Baby Biles had sported Simone-inspired looks. During the Olympics, Ronni made sure to show up to every event, cheering on her aunt in the most adorable way. Baby Biles even wore matching leotards with Simone, including the ‘Go For Glory’ uniform that Simone wore at the 2023 Xfinity Gymnastics Championships. Little Ronni even made the trip to California to cheer her aunt on as Simone started her redemption journey.
When Simone’s “Gold Over America” tour came to Houston, Baby Biles was there, cheering on her aunt with all the excitement she could muster. Sammi Biles, her mother shared a heartwarming clip on Instagram of Baby Biles entering the Toyota Center, chanting “TT” as she saw her aunt on the big screen. Sammi joined in, chanting “TT go, TT go,” matching Ronni’s excitement. It was clear that Baby Biles had been soaking up all the inspiration from her legendary aunt whether it led to a gymnastics career just being the ultimate supporter, or now completing her absence, she was definitely on the path to greatness!
Have something to say?
Let the world know your perspective.
Debate
Simone Biles chose love over tradition this Christmas—would you do the same for your partner?

author: Liz Dunphy
title: Two Cork special schools to join pilot project to get therapists
text: Two Cork special schools are among 10 nationally to join a pilot project to have desperately-needed therapists introduced from January 1. Munster’s largest special school, [St Killian’s in Mayfield](https://www.irishexaminer.com/news/munster/arid-41461171.html), along with the [East Cork Community Special School in Carrigtwohill](https://www.irishexaminer.com/news/munster/arid-41222281.html), are to join the second in-school therapies pilot project from January, Minister Colm Burke told the Irish Examiner on Thursday night. St Killian’s Special School principal Sue Lenihan has told how students have been distressed since therapists were removed from schools in 2019. “Therapy in these schools is essential," Ms Lenihan said. Although St Killian’s school had no official notice of the move to join the pilot, Mr Burke, Minister of State for Public Health announced the decision on social media on Thursday evening. He wrote: “The focus of the pilot is to provide the effective delivery of enhanced in-school therapy supports to children in selected special schools. It will provide full-time therapist for the school.” He thanked his Fine Gael colleague Hildegarde Naughton, Minister of State for Special Education and Inclusion, for “her work on securing this vital support". His announcement came hours before Taoiseach Simon Harris is to dissolve the Dáil on Friday, kicking off a three-week election campaign to polling day on November 29. Last month, interim funding of €40,000 was announced to cover the cost of private therapists at St Killian's Special School until December, following a year-long protest campaign by the school and parents. But St Killian’s principal Sue Linehan said there is a process they must follow before they can draw down that money which has been more difficult than they anticipated. On Thursday night, Ms Lenihan said: She said that getting the pilot scheme up and running had been a problem in other Cork schools already admitted to the first tranche of the in-schools therapies pilot programme. “So we don’t know what it looks like yet. "We want to know the staffing levels, the allocation, who will be making decisions. It needs a whole process, not just ‘pay for therapists'. "We’ll have to triage the most complex cases first, and check that process. There’s a lot involved." Although Ms Lenihan heard of some issues implementing the pilot programme in Cork, she said that it has been working well in schools in other counties. Mick Barry, Solidarity and Socialist TD for Cork North Central, accused the government of "making grand announcements" on the eve of the election but "not delivering the goods." “St Killian's was promised €40K to hire therapists - but hasn't received any money yet," Mr Barry wrote. "Now being told they will be included in 2nd tranche of a therapists in-schools pilot - when 1st tranche isn't up and running yet." St Killian’s Special School has 104 pupils. It needs a psychologist, a social worker, an occupational therapist (OT), a speech and language therapist (SLT), and a play therapist, Ms Lenihan said. Under the current funding scheme it will only be entitled to an OT and an SLT with possible access to play therapy and behavioural therapy. But Ms Lenihan said that any steps to return therapists to the school would be very welcome and are necessary. Anne Rabbitte, the minister of state for disability, previously told the Dáil that 10 schools will be selected in an extension of the in-schools therapies pilot project.

author: EFE
title: Detenidas en Austria tres personas por una posible amenaza terrorista en Navidad
text:
Las autoridades de Austria han detenido a tres personas de círculos islamistas en
[Viena](/tags/viena/) ante informaciones sobre posibles ataques terroristas en torno a la Navidad y el Año Nuevo, informó hoy la televisión pública ORF.
Una portavoz de la Fiscalía de Viena, confirmó este domingo las detenciones aunque matizó que no existen planes concretos de ataques contra objetivos en Viena.
Las autoridades austríacas no dieron a conocer ni las identidades ni nacionalidades de los detenidos.
Varias viviendas fueron registradas, donde los agentes se incautaron de soportes de datos, que son analizados por expertos.
La
[Policía](/tags/policia/) austríaca había informado anteriormente que en Internet circula un llamamiento terrorista para ataques contra eventos cristianos en torno al 24 de diciembre en Europa.
"Debido a la actual evaluación de la amenaza por parte de la Oficina para la Protección de la Constitución y al todavía elevado nivel de alerta terrorista, existe en general un mayor riesgo en Austria durante las fiestas navideñas", declaró la dirección de la Policía de Viena.
En el centro de las medidas de seguridad se encuentran iglesias y eventos religiosos, así como mercadillos de
[Navidad](/tags/navidad/), explicaron las autoridades.
La Policía austríaca aseguró que se están tomando medidas de
[seguridad ](/tags/seguridad/)de acuerdo a la necesidad en cada momento, incluyendo el control de identidad de visitantes de eventos navideños.
Según fotos publicadas por la prensa electrónica austríaca, varios vehículos policiales y numerosos agentes armados se encontraban este domingo en los entornos de la Catedral de San Esteban, en pleno casco antiguo de Viena, una zona abarrotada de turistas en esta época del año.
El diario alemán "Bild" había informado este sábado de que las autoridades de Alemania, Austria y España están manejando informaciones sobre posibles atentados en torno a la Navidad y el Año Nuevo en Europa.
El 2 de noviembre de 2020, el centro de la capital austríaca fue objetivo de un atentado islamista en el que murieron cuatro personas y una veintena resultaron heridas.

author: Deccan Chronicle
title: I am a big fan of Katrina
text:
Home » Entertainment » Bollywood » January 5, 2024 Entertainment I am a big fan of Katrina Deccan Chronicle.| Lipika Varma
Published on: January 5, 2024 | Updated on: January 5, 2024 Actors Katrina, Vijay Sethupathi and director Sriram Raghavan speak out about their experience working on the film Merry Christmas Vijay Sethupathi and Katrina Kaif
Merry Christmas, starring Katrina Kaif and Vijay Sethupathi and directed by Sriram Raghavan is a suspenseful dark thriller filmed simultaneously in Hindi and Tamil and produced by Ramesh Taurani and Sanjay Routray. Speaking at the first press conference of the film, coinciding with the trailer release, Katrina, Vijay and Shriram answered a barrage of questions from the media.
Wish list of directors/actors from Bollywood
I don’t have any particular wish list — Isske sath kam karna hai, uske sath kam karna hai...aisa kuch nahi hai. Mostly, my directors choose their actors, I don’t discuss that. I am totally dependent on the filmmakers and of course the story – that’s my main concern.
On working with Katrina
I am a very big fan of Katrina. I was very happy when I met her on the first day. She is a very dedicated actor. She asks many questions and thinks about the part. She may come with an idea but also listens to others’ suggestions. She puts in so much sensibility and effort into her performance. That’s the reason she has been in the industry for so long. I feel she is not only beautiful but also sensible.
On working with director Shriram Raghavan
I met Shriram Sir for the first time in Melbourne. At first sight I felt he was a very serious man. I spent almost 30 days with him. I learned a lot from him. I understood him and knew what he was expecting me to do in a particular scene. I have learnt to utilize freedom of thought and expressions which I will carry forward while shooting for other films.
On choosing Merry Christmas
It has always been my intention to be associated with good stories. It’s not just the actors, the director is also of utmost importance. Working with director Shriram Raghavan was on my bucket list and this story was right for me as well.
On making a change from commercial entertainers
You will feel a little nervous or fearful when you step out of the commercial entertainer. But you need to overcome that fear. The experience is worthwhile for me as an actor and performer. I give my heart and soul to every film.
Expectations from Merry Christmas
I think every film has its audience. Also, Shriram Raghavan has a loyal fan following. We have made a film that we are very proud about. Waiting to watch the reaction of the audiences.
"I feel she [Katrina] is not only beautiful but also sensible."
"You will feel a little nervous or fearful when you step out of the commercial entertainer."

author: Brian Teo
title: Immersive encounter with van Gogh, Klimt masterpieces at Parkview Square
text:
SINGAPORE – About 130 people got the chance to immerse themselves in the masterpieces of Gustav Klimt and Vincent van Gogh in a dynamic 360-degree art experience at Parkview Square in North Bridge Road a day before the event’s opening.
Groundseesaw, a digital art exhibition brand by Seoul-based Media & Art, is set to present three exhibitions at Parkview Square starting Jan 24, 2025.
Alongside the continuing Monet Inside exhibition, the venue unveiled two new immersive experiences: Gustav Klimt: Timeless Beauty and Van Gogh Inside: Love, Vincent.
These exhibitions offer visitors an opportunity to explore the masterpieces of Claude Monet, Gustav Klimt, and Vincent van Gogh through a dynamic 360-degree art experience.
Set across five screens—each over 6m high—the theatrical experience is designed to immerse guests in the colourful worlds of these iconic artists.
The exhibitions will rotate timeslots daily, ensuring that every visit offers a fresh encounter.
Gustav Klimt: Timeless Beauty, invites visitors to enter the captivating world of Klimt, the master of Art Nouveau, and experience his iconic works such as The Kiss.
The exhibition’s striking digital projections highlight the intricate gold-leaf details that define Klimt’s art, while music and vibrant visuals bring his themes of love, beauty, and the human experience to the forefront.
Van Gogh Inside: Love, Vincent delves into the emotional and expressive world of Vincent van Gogh, one of history’s most revolutionary artists.
The exhibition features immersive projections of works like Starry Night and Sunflowers, accompanied by 11 original orchestral soundtracks that amplify the intensity of van Gogh’s brushstrokes and passion.
Visitors are encouraged to secure their tickets early on the Fever app or website.
Where: 3rd floor, 600 North Bridge Road, Parkview Square, Singapore 188778
When: From Jan 24, 2025. Open daily from 10am to 8pm
Admission: For standard admission, tickets cost $20–$25 on weekdays and $25–$30 on weekends before discounts
Info: www.groundseesaw.com
- Brian Teo is a photojournalist at The Straits Times. A sociology major, he is interested in exploring the societal significance of religious and cultural traditions.
Join ST's Telegram channel and get the latest breaking news delivered to you.

author: Rosario3
title: Los Murciélagos eliminaron a Brasil e irán por el oro paralímpico ante Francia
text:
En la previa del partido de
Argentina por Eliminatorias, una alegría de la selección de fútbol para ciegos, Los Murciélagos, que este jueves eliminaron a Brasil y jugarán la final de los Juegos Paralímpicos París 2024, que será nada menos que ante Francia.
El equipo nacional masculino de la especialidad empató 0-0 por semifinales y avanzó por penales (4-3) para dar la sorpresa ante los brasileños, que aspiraban a su sexto oro consecutivo en fútbol-5 para ciegos.
Desde que se introdujo en el programa competitivo de los Paralímpicos hace justo veinte años en Grecia, en Atenas 2004, Brasil siempre ha subido a lo más alto del podio para recoger un oro y escuchar su himno nacional.
En esta ocasión, a los pies de la Torre Eiffel, en pleno centro de París, en una instalación montada expresamente para el fútbol ciegos, Brasil no podrá cumplir su objetivo porque encontró en Argentina un rival muy aguerrido, que le plantó cara y que consiguió llevar el partido a los penales, donde la fortuna cayó del lado de la Albiceleste.
¡LOS MURCIÉLAGOS HACEN HISTORIA EN PARÍS E IRÁN POR LA MEDALLA DORADA! ������— TyC Sports (@TyCSports)
El seleccionado masculino de fútbol para ciegos derrotó por penales a Brasil, que no había perdido ni una sola vez en su historia en un Juego Paralímpico y accedió a la final de
[#París2024]. [pic.twitter.com/xJVvvNQEsf] [September 5, 2024]
La otra semifinal disputada entre Colombia y Francia se la llevó la selección gala con un gol de Frederic Villeroux a los 26 minutos.
El partido por el bronce entre Colombia y Brasil se disputará el sábado 7 de septiembre a las 12.30 y la final entre Francia y Argentina a las 15.

author: La Stampa
title: Il fine settimana in riviera inizia con le code sulla A10: cinque chilometri tra Spotorno e Feglino - La Stampa
text:
Il cantiere di Spotorno sta creando i primi disagi alle persone che hanno deciso di passare questo fine settimana in riviera ligure, nel Savonese. Da questa mattina ci sono code, arrivate per il momento anche a una lunghezza di 5 chilometri tra Spotorno e Feglino, in direzione Francia, a causa dei lavori. Nel corso della mattinata il serpentoneè arrivato a undici chilometri. Lo ha segnalato la stessa concessionaria dell’autostrada, che invita alla massima prudenza visto il previsto aumento del traffico per il weekend.
La zona è interessata da lavori programmati, obbligando Concessioni del Tirreno (che gestisce la tratta) a chiudere l’entrata al casello di Spotorno in direzione Italia fino alle ore 14 del 16 novembre.
Molte persone, provenienti dal Piemonte e Lombardia e diretti alle località turistiche del Savonese hanno scelto anche percorsi alternativi attraverso le provinciali interne, causando altrettanti rallentamenti. La conformazione delle direttrici extraurbane non riesce a sopportare un eccessivo carico di traffico. I disagi, è prevedibile, dureranno tutta la giornata.
Leggi i commenti I commenti dei lettori Acquista da 0.7€ /sett
